DataElement.preferredName: Derkay Recurrent Papillomatosis Result Other Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named other anatomic site examined for recurrent papillomatosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Derkay Staging System Papillomatosis Assessment Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time._Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site._The result of an action._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time.:Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time.
Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR clinical trial.8.11.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A structure of special sense serving as an organ of the sense of smell and as an entrance to the respiratory tract.

Concepts.definition: A structure of special sense serving as an organ of the sense of smell and as an entrance to the respiratory tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (PAL-et) The roof of the mouth. The front portion is bony (hard palate), and the back portion is muscular (soft palate).

Concepts.definition: The roof of the oral cavity. It separates the oral cavity from the nasal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (FAIR-inks) The hollow tube about 5 inches long that starts behind the nose and ends at the top of the trachea (windpipe) and esophagus (the tube that goes to the stomach).

Concepts.definition: A hollow tube that starts posterior to the mouth and nasal cavity and ends superior to the trachea and esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
